content.description: From sidepulls on the lower part of the hanging prow feature, climb straight up with a good crimp on the face and better, higher sidepull jugs. Hit the lip and mantle.
content.location: From Incestual Gingerbread House Cats, head S along the moraine and just a touch downhill (towards geronimo) and keep your eye out for this darker boulder. It is probably only 150 feet away, but as it faces downhill, can be tricky to locate.

content.description:
Start sitting with the cool flake feature. Do a big reach up and left to a small tooth crimp in the bottom of the shallow dihedral feature. Use this and small crimps to reach higher to a small, good crimp and topout straight up.

About the name... A good friend had mentioned he wanted to adopt a kitten and someone suggested he go to downtown Leavenworth to the Gingerbread factory and adopt one for free. Anyone who has been downtown late at night or god-forbid grew up here, knows the gingerbread factory is the center of the universe for garbage-fattened raccoons, rats and generations of feral cats. His description of the cats to be found there inspired the name of the boulder. Thanks Max.
content.location: From the parking area, head straight up the hill (W) instead of into the thinned forest towards the main cluster. From the top of the hill (moraine), look for a a flat stump on the crest and below it a bigish boulder. It is pretty much a straight line from the car and only about 5 minutes but will require some searching as the actual route faces downhill.
